title: How rising obesity epidemic will take a bite out of world's economies
text:
On the day the UK’s chief medical officer warned children are “drowning in a flood of unhealthy food and drink options”, the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development has produced a sobering new study on the impact of bulging waistlines on global growth.

Dame Sally Davies’ intervention – calling for an extension of the UK’s sugar tax – comes as the OECD’s report puts the “gross” into Gross Domestic Product. The think tank estimates that the 36 biggest economies will see an average 3.3pc hit to growth by 2050 thanks to an overweight workforce.
